content.text: If individual #1 in the following pedigree <image 1> is a heterozygote for a rare, AR disease, what is the probability that individual #7 will be affected by the disease? Assume that #2 and the spouses of #3 and #4 are not carriers.

Individual #1 is a heterozygote for a rare, AR disease, which means that they are carriers of the disease allele. In an autosomal recessive ( (AR) inheritance pattern, an individual must inherit two copies of the disease allele (one from each parent) to be affected by the disease. Therefore, individual #7 has a 25% chance of being affected by the disease.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
